website_summaries.verdict: A professional-grade fall arrest and safety harness with added comfort points, but its breakaways and cam locks may work loose over time.
pros: Back and shoulder support add comfort to this safety harness
Easy to adjust to fit around bulky clothing
Favored by many linemen for its multiple attachment points and all-day comfort
cons: Tool belt may be too small for some users (though larger sizes can be ordered)
Harness can pinch at the hips and tug at the shoulders when in a swing rig
Cam locks can turn to unlocked position when wearing

customer_reviews.title: It survived the Pit of Death
customer_reviews.text: I live in the tech world but support construction customers in my day to day. I purchased this harness to do some testing for a VR training simulator I'm working on at home. The first thing I noticed was the engineering. This thing has been through the testing ringer and user experience is obviously a priority. It's also super adjustable and comfortable. Last week I finally had the chance to test this harness in a real life situation: Descending the "Pit of Death" (ammo supply access way) on the USS Iowa Battleship. Harness did great and we were able to complete our mission on time and on target. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty Rehab

customer_reviews.title: Buy this harness
customer_reviews.text: This harness is what you want if you are an Ironworker or anything like that. great belt you can hang a bunch of bags and tools on. locking Cobra buckles on the legs and chest are much nicer than old school buckles. padding where you want it while wearing it and if you do fall there is padding in the legs where you will want it. In the summer you will sweat a little more than in a really thin nylon bare harness but in my mind it's worth it for the features. I am 6'1'' and 185 lbs. Medium size fits me perfect.

customer_reviews.title: The belt does not give much room for bags and tool frogs along with the padded leg straps are cumbersome and very difficult to m
customer_reviews.text: Have not worn this harness in 3yrs until I bought this one again. This is the second Exofit NEX I have had in my 10yr Ironworking career. It is the same as I remember it. The belt does not give much room for bags and tool frogs along with the padded leg straps are cumbersome and very difficult to make comfortable (impossible) for all day wear. Only time it's comfortable is when sitting still and working. I do love the quick release straps, but I probably won't get them again. I will not buy another EXOFit NEX but will only purchase DBI harnesses. They are still the best.
